message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest cerebral palsy, and among the options, prematurity is the most common risk factor for developing this condition. Perinatal hypoxic injury and stroke can also contribute to cerebral palsy, but they are less common risk factors. Multiparity does not increase the risk of cerebral palsy.
